page.title: 07CHANGING TIMES IN BURGHILL
page.content: We chatted with John Bourne of Home Farm.Mr Bourne is 82 yrs. old and sleeps in the bedroom where he was born. He went to our school and remembers the gallery where the infants sat.In his youth there were only four cars in Burghill and one phone at the P.O. Roads were not tarred and heaps of stones were kept for repairs. Electricity came in 1926/7, provided by City of Hereford Electricity Dept. He remembered the Misses Woodhouse who lived at the Court. Boys would raise their hats to them and girls curtsied. He knew the man who murdered them in 1926! He has seen many changes in the size of Burghill and also changes in farming.He remembers when many more people worked on the land. He felt life was hard but happier then.
